questions.question: Simplify \( \frac{36(a + 1)}{7} \div \frac{9(b + 1)}{28} \).
Rearrange the formula \( a = 2bv + xk \) to make \( v \) the subject.
questions.question_type: Changing the subject of a formula

questions.question: Solve the simultaneous equations: \( 4x + 7y = 23 \) and \( 6x - 2y = 3 \).
questions.question_type: Solving simultaneous equations using the method of elimination

questions.question: Write as a single fraction in its simplest form: \( \frac{2x - 3y}{(x - y)(xy)} + \frac{3}{xy} \).
Faiz invested $25,000 in an account which paid simple interest. At the end of 9 months, the value of the investment was $26,500. Calculate the interest rate per annum of the investment.

Jane exchanged 500 Singapore dollars ($) into Thai baht (THB) when the exchange rate was $1 = 26.77 THB. She travelled to Thailand and spent 10,600 THB. On her return to Singapore, she exchanged the remaining Thai baht into dollars with the exchange rate $1 = 26.88 THB. Calculate the amount she received in dollars. Correct your answer to the nearest cent.

The cash price of a furniture set was $2700. Kim bought the set under a hire purchase scheme: 15\% deposit and monthly instalments of $68 for 36 months. Calculate the amount of interest paid as a percentage of the cash price.
By selling an item at 25\% discount off the marked price, a shopkeeper still makes 10\% profit on his cost. If the cost price is $180, calculate the marked price of the item.
questions.question_type: Finding the original value using reverse percentages

questions.question: The diagram shows a rectangular cardboard ABCD with AB = (3x + 1) cm and AD = (x + 13) cm. A square of side 3 cm is cut from each corner. The remaining cardboard is then folded along the dotted lines to form an open rectangular box with base PQRS and height 3 cm. The volume of the tray is 930 cm^3. (a) Form an equation, in terms of x, to represent this information and show that it simplifies to 3x^2 + 16x - 345 = 0.
Solve the equation 3x^2 + 16x - 345 = 0. Give your solutions correct to two decimal places.
questions.question_type: Solving quadratic equations by quadratic formula

questions.question: Find the length of the diagonal SQ.
A is the point (3, 7) and B is the point (13, -8). (i) Find \overrightarrow{AB}.
Given that 2\overrightarrow{BA} = \overrightarrow{AP}, find the coordinates of P.

In triangle OCB, A is the midpoint of OC and P is the point on CB such that \frac{3}{4}CP = CB. The line OB is produced to D such that OB = 2BD. 2\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a} and 2\overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}. (i) Express \overrightarrow{CP} in terms of \mathbf{a} and \mathbf{b}, as simply as possible.
questions.question_type: Solving a geometric problem involving vectors

questions.question: Express \overrightarrow{AP} in terms of \mathbf{a} and \mathbf{b}, as simply as possible.
Show that A, P and D lie on the same straight line.
questions.question_type: Finding the equation of a straight line

questions.question: Find \( \text{Area of } \triangle OCB \) and \( \text{Area of } \triangle CPD \).
A, B, C and D are four points on level ground, with B due east of A. AC = 43 \text{ m}, CD = 32 \text{ m}, AD = 67 \text{ m}, \angle CAB = 52^\circ \text{ and } \angle ABC = 33^\circ.
questions.question_type: Finding the length of a line segment

questions.question: Calculate the bearing of B from C.
Calculate AB.
questions.question_type: Finding the length of a line segment

questions.question: Calculate \( \angle CDA \).
questions.question_type: Finding unknown angles in a parallelogram

questions.question: A drone hovers 60 m vertically above D. Find the angle of depression of A from the drone.
questions.question_type: Finding the distance, given the angle of depression

questions.question: The diagram shows a circle with centre O. TA and TB are tangents to the circle at A and B respectively. AT produced meets OB produced at X.
questions.question_type: Applying the angles properties of circles

questions.question: Show that triangle OAX is similar to triangle TBX. Give a reason for each statement you make.
XB = 12 \text{ cm} and TX = 13 \text{ cm}. Find OA.
Calculate, as a fraction in its simplest form, the numerical value of the ratio \( \frac{\text{area of triangle } TBX}{\text{area of quadrilateral } OATB} \).
Calculate the reflex angle AOB in radians.
questions.question_type: Applying the angles properties of circles

questions.question: Complete the table of values for \( y = 16 - 10x - x^2 \).
On the grid opposite, draw the graph of \( y = 16 - 10x - x^2 \) for \( 1 \leq x \leq 9 \).
By drawing a tangent, find the gradient of the curve at \( x = 3 \).
questions.question_type: Estimating the gradient of a curve

questions.question: Use your graph to solve \( 16 - 10x - x^2 = 0 \).
questions.question_type: Finding the solutions of an equation graphically

questions.question: The straight line \( y = mx - 1 \) intersects the curve \( y = 16 - 10x - x^2 \) at two points. (i) Write down and simplify the equation, in terms of \( m \), in the form \( Ax^2 + Bx + 16 = 0 \), which is satisfied by the values of \( x \) at the points of intersection.
questions.question_type: Finding the solutions of an equation graphically

questions.question: (ii) If the values of \( y \) at the points of intersection are greater than or equal to zero, find the least value of \( m \).
questions.question_type: Finding the solutions of an equation graphically

questions.question: Use the curve to find (i) the median mass of the eggs.
(ii) the interquartile range.
(iii) the 10th percentile.
An egg is classified as ‘Medium’ if its mass is greater than or equal to 50 g but less than 56 g. Two eggs are chosen at random. Calculate the probability that both are ‘Medium’ eggs.
questions.question_type: Finding the probability involving independent events

questions.question: The masses, in grams, of a second batch of 300 eggs are recorded and are represented by the box-and-whisker diagram below. (i) Which batch of the eggs has more consistent mass? Justify your answer using appropriate figures.
(ii) The right whisker is longer than the left whisker. Explain what this tells us about the distribution of the data set.
